essay.question-text: The professor describes how yellow journalism came to be. Explain how this information about yellow journalism is related to the information in the reading passage.
essay.sample-answer-text:
SAMPLE ANSWER
In this set of materials, the reading passage describes a type of journalism called yellow journalism, and the professor describes how this type of journalism came about.
The reading passage describes the techniques that are used to create yellow journalism. Journalists may present one side of the story, emphasize lurid details, exaggerate facts, or fail to check facts. Newspapers may put sensational stories on the front page and use sensational banner headlines and photos.
In the lecture, the professor talks about the history of yellow journalism. In the 1890s, there was a battle for circulation between Joseph Pulitzer's New York World and William Randolph Hearst's New York Journal, and the way that they battled was to use really sensational stories. During this time, Pulitzer had a popular cartoon named Yellow Kid in his newspaper. The sensational type of journalism in his newspaper and in Hearst's newspaper came to be called yellow journalism because of this cartoon.
